strings.s: Here am I again...

I got this one... **

Well... It's time to start working on slab...
I'll need your help again,
Sure thing...
Okay... I think the writings on the slab are just a short poem about the daily life of a commoner who lived in the Andes civilization...
And now that we have the translation book, we can use it create a map to the temple...
I don't get it... How can you draw a map by just reading the story of an ancient dude?
That cave McGuffin got lost inside is like a dungeon... There's probably a unique sequence of directions encoded in the poem that will guide us through it...
I believe each one of these verses has a clue to which one of the paths we should choose inside the tunnels in order to find the temple...
Humm... That's exactly the kind of bullshit the Dungeon Master would come up with...
Who!?
Oh... Nobody... Forget about it...
Let's just work the the slab, right? What kind of clue you can read on it?
Okay... Let's see...
The first verses can be translated to: *The villager wakes up and walks toward the sunrise...*
I wonder what direction does it mean...
Sunrise... Obvisouly it says to go EAST after entering the cave...
Oh... Of course! Well done,
Hum... I don't think so... Let me guess...
It talks about the sunrise, so it probably means to go EAST after entering the cave...
Oh... Sure... Whatever...
Okay... We start going EAST, then...
...the next verses can be translated to: *He reaches the river and turn left to the farms...*
I wonder what direction does it mean...
If you're facing east and then turn left, then it means to go NORTH...
Nice one,
Are you sure? Doesn't make much sense...
I believe... turning left while facing east probably means to go NORTH...
Oh... Sure... Whatever...
Okay... We're going NORTH, then...
...the next verses can be translated to: *He works the whole day follow the sun again as it goes down...*
I wonder what direction does it mean...
Following the sunset obviously means to go WEST this time...
Exactly! You got this one,
Hum... I don't think so... Let me guess...
It says about following the sunset... so it probably means go WEST this time...
Oh... Sure... Whatever...
Okay... Now we're going WEST, then...
...the final verses can be translated to: *He reachs a crossroad and turn right hearing the Goddess call...*
I wonder what direction does it mean...
If you're facing west and then turn right, then it means to go NORTH again...
Nice one,
Are you sure? Doesn't make much sense...
I believe... turning right while facing west probably means to go NORTH...
Oh... Sure... Whatever...
North
East
West
South
I... I think that's it... We're so close now...
If we follow this sequence of directions back at the village cave... We'll find the temple!!
